thread.section_title: High School Sports - NY Daily News
thread.title: High school quarterback suspended for inappropriate tickle
thread.title_full: High school quarterback suspended for inappropriate tickle

author: MICHAEL SCACCO
title: High school quarterback suspended for inappropriate tickle
text:
Brent Drinkut/AP West Salem freshman quarterback Garrett Moore was suspended for inappropriately touching a teammate. 
A high school quarterback in Oregon was suspended for allegedly touching a center inappropriately during a snap at practice. 
The quarterback, Garrett Moore, is on the third string for the West Salem High School’s team and has only been on the field for one play — in which he threw a touchdown pass. 
Moore told the Statesman Journal that the allegations stemmed from taking the snap during the Oct. 2 practice from a player with whom he was having a beef. 
"He wanted me to go way up there and it felt very uncomfortable," Moore told the paper. 
"I was, like, moving my hands and I touched him and he started laughing. I guess I tickled him. I wouldn't mean to. That's kind of weird." Brent Drinkut/AP The alleged incident occurred on October 2 and Moore was suspended on October 6. 
After the awkward play, the player at center — who had shoved Moore to the ground earlier in the practice — moved to a position on the defense. He later approached Moore to embrace him. 
"He acted like he was giving me a hug and he kneed me in my crotch," Moore told the paper. 
"He said that he did that because I spat on his shoe, even though he was five feet in front of me." 
A few days later, Moore was pulled out of class and sent to the office of the assistant principal, Jim Miller — who asked about the alleged tickle during practice. 
"I'm like, 'I guess,'" Moore recalled. 
"He was laughing when I touched him. I didn't mean to say tickle. I said tickle because he laughed." 
Moore's mother was called and he was suspended with a note from Miller that read: "Student inappropriately touched another student during football practice." 
Moore's mother Tamara Moore plans to appeal the suspension.
